result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles T Ritchie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Must undergo Anger Management assessment and follow throught with any recommendations.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles T Ritchie in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:36 AM. State - resolved - amend count #1 to county ordinace of DC with a $500.00 fine plus costs, #2 - plead as alleged, 12 months probation with conditions of: $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges, anger management and follow thru, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school, 50 hours of community service. Ritchie and Arbuckle agree. Court amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO. Ritchie pleads NC to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - has complied with victim notification requirements with no response or VIS - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Arbuckle makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Ritchie withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #2 - AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO (including $10.00 drug abuse surcharge), no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 50 hours of community service, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 8, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
Jury trial on February 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Paul Arbuckle in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:56 AM. Arbuckle unaware of where his client is. State asks for forfeiture of bond and warrant, body or $1000. Officer indicates there is a Charles Ritchie in FC jail. RE-called on the record, 11:04 AM. Charles Ritchie now appears via video from FC jail. Ritchie indicates he is on a probation hold. Arbuckle has not had contact with Ritchie. Ritchie makes statement. Court set for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for February 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on January 4, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Charles T Ritchie in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:44 AM. Ritchie and Arbuckle have complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG plea. Court continues bond, accepts plea, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Per email from Attorney Ferguson on 10/26/16, she has not yet been officially retained so she has been taken off the case.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles T Ritchie in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:27 AM. Ritchie has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Ritchie understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney and states that he has retained Amy Ferguson but she could not be here today. Court continues bond, sets for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
